newsitem.title: USA: Stone Container raises pulp prices.
newsitem.headline: Stone Container raises pulp prices.

text.p: Stone Container Corp, a paper maker, said it raised prices for market pulp effective July 1, following an increase in May.

"Market conditions have improved for all of our company's product lines," Roger Stone, chairman, said in a statement. "Industry demand for containerboard and corrugated containers, which represent a majority of our revenues, continues to be healthy, and we believe that the former inventory overhang has been significantly reduced, and probably eliminated."
Stone Container said Abitibi-Consolidated Inc, of which it owns 25.2 percent, has raised newsprint prices and has also announced a further price increase for the fourth quarter.

"It appears that our industry has dealt successfully with the overcapacity which has plagued us for the past two years, and a reasonable balance between supply and demand has been reached," Stone said. "With very little capacity growth expected in the near-term, we believe we are in the beginning stage of a long-awaited recovery."
